title: release automation milestone 3 part 1
body:
### INCLUDED CHANGES:

(copy and paste from teh commit)

change to the release-automation crate:

- add `crate fixup-release`s command

  this command queries crates.io for all crate versions in the most
  recent release. it will print every crate that hasn't been published
  and optionally bump their version to a develop version to indicate a
  re-release is necessary.

- rework checking behavior

  this separates the lockfile update from the consistency check.  the
  advantage is that this lets use use the `--offline` argument in the
  lockfile update step.

- custom cargo-target-dir nested cargo

  the main use-case for this are the CLI tests. if they run
  concurrently, which is the default in rust tests, they will create
  conflicts if they share a target directory. hence the tests require
  setting a custom target dir for each test workspace.

- readd separate check command

  i erroneously removed this command. we do need this after all since
  the `cargo publish --dry-run` sometimes doesn't reach the verification
  when some crates have already bumped to their dev versions.

- output some stats on publishing

- lower version to prepare for releases

changes to CI:

- extract and extend release tests into a separate job and

  as a job in parallel to `merge-test` introduce `merge-release-test`,
  which ensures that the code remains releasable. by using a parallel
  job we don't extend wall-time for developers who are waiting on CI.

### TODO:
- [x] CHANGELOG(s) updated with appropriate info

---

Demonstrates the failure that's fixed in #974

title: Initial adding of the `WebAppManifest` and corresponding command
body:
This is a preliminary view on the new web app manifest format. As discussed with @zippy , this is to be included in `hc` and used alongside `hc dna` and `hc app`. This is what the manifest looks like for now:

```yaml
---
manifest_version: "1"
name: test
ui:
  bundled: "./path/to/my/ui.zip"
happ_manifest:
  bundled: "./path/to/my/happ-bundle.happ"
```

Questions:
- Do we need to include anything else at this stage from the hackmd document?
- I have concerns about some of the fields specified in that hackmd, as some of them don't pertain to happs that have web UIs, but in general to any happ bundle.

### INCLUDED CHANGES:
- Added `WebAppManifest` in `holochain_types`.
- Added `hc web-app` subcommand.

### TODO:
- [x] CHANGELOG(s) updated with appropriate info
- [x] Finish all necessary documentation

title: Fix ToSql impl for Timestamp to use milliseconds
body: The ToSql implementation for Timestamp was using the raw seconds component of Timestamp, not the proper millisecond conversion. This fixes that, and makes the timestamp components private with minimal accessor fns, since the implementation detail should not matter, and it was not clear what the ToSql impl was doing by just seeing `self.0`.

This uses the `ScenarioDef` struct to actually construct multi-conductor scenarios:

title: Refactor and test metrics / choosing the next node
body:
This refactors and tests the in memory metrics for the gossip module.
This is not the same as the metrics database although we probably will flush from this in memory to the database in a future pr.
The aim of the in memory metrics is to help the gossip module make the better choices when choosing the next node to gossip with.
This is definitely easier to understand then before and much easier to test.
It also appears to be faster because there are less poor choices that result in gossip rounds with node data exchanged although I will confirm this in a future PR.

title: nix-hc-binary-wrapper: support for running from a different directory

labels.name: tiny
labels.description: This PR is really small and easy to review

body:
Giving the binary wrapper a separate target directory avoids sharing the
compiler cache with compilation of other crates in the repository, that
could have other feature sets. This is because sharing the target
directory has surfaced compiler errors that suggest erroneous cache
handling.

As an example, from a directory next to the holochain directory you
could run:

```
nix-shell ../holochain/shell.nix --argstr flavor happDev --run "make test"
```

Where `make test` could run the binary wrapper script `holochain`.


---

Split off #869

The second commit exposes the issue which is now documented on CI in [this failed run](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/holochain/holochain/7061/workflows/9640c641-2235-4b2f-b1a4-01df2b33fa9f/jobs/8631?invite=true#step-104-3456).

After rebasing/merging in https://github.com/holochain/holochain/pull/897 the error should go away.

body:
Otherwise this causes a compiler error that surfaced with `cargo check --all-features`.
As a next step I'd like to identify why this error wasn't caught by our CI test.

title: 2021 07 28 accept preflight
body:
changes:

- `fixt!` accepts an expression for indexing
- implements `accept_countersigning_preflight_request` in the HDK and as a host_fn
- adds `session_times_from_millis` to the HDK
- impl `From` for entry types to `AppEntryBytes` to make constructing a countersigned entry by hand easier
- impl `From` to build `Header` directly from countersigning session data
- changed `sys_time` to return a `Timestamp` instead of a `Duration`
- implements chain locking and unlocking due to an accepted preflight request and subsequent countersigned entry commit
- both `create` and `update` support countersigned entries, notably extracting the headers from the session data instead of building new headers
- fixed some bugs in the test harness
- chain head query includes timestamp and new header logic always ensures the timestamp is at least the top time
- guard (error) against any/all entries other than a single commit per flush of the countersigning entry the current chain lock is for (i.e. cannot commit unrelated entries at the same time)
- adds a new test wasm for countersigning tests

folllowups:

- chain should only unlock when the full header set is gathered for all signers
- should not be possible to commit the same header twice
- all header handling on the network

title: Check if agent is authority and set dht arcs.
body:
This makes the cascade check with kitsune if the current agent is an authority before doing gets etc.
This also updates the agent info's arc using the peer density calculation. Calculating the real storage arc length is behind a feature flag `sharded`. If this is not set then all agents get a full arc.

title: 2021 07 20 remote call multi
body:
implements multi-call for:

- `remote_call`
- `call`
- `get`
- `get_details`
- `get_links`
- `get_link_details`

ostensibly we only need `remote_call` for countersigning, but feedback from community is that having to sequentially loop over these common HDK functions is a pain point, so i enabled all of them to be async over a vector of inputs

title: [TK-10011] Revert most recent develop versions and apply them only to changed crates
body:
This reverts the dev version bump that was part of the most recent release and applies them to changed crates since then using the release-automation tool.

The rationale here is setting the dev versions only when there was an actual change in a crate. Otherwise, its' not possible to release a crate that depends on an unchanged crate, since its develop version won't be published and also isn't included in the release.

title: WIP mocks and restructure for unit testing gossip

- Moves all networking concerns, including incoming and outgoing queues, to an outer `ShardedGossipNetworking` layer, so that `ShardedGossip` can be more easily unit tested
- Makes `process_incoming()` return its outgoing messages rather than mutating the queue directly

title: Preliminary `contrafact::Fact` definitions for various Holochain types
body:
Introduces [contrafact](https://github.com/maackle/contrafact-rs) to the repo. This is a supplement to fixturators which leaves gaps in a few cases:

- types which are hard/onerous/impossible to define Fixturators
    - anything that can impl Arbitrary can be "contrafactified", and Arbitrary has a very flexible derive macro
- domain-specific constraints on fixturator data must be defined as custom Curves, but the Curve must be defined for the fixturators of all contained types as well, which doesn't compose well
    - in contrast, Facts can be composed in a nested fashion via lenses, maximizing code reuse and minimizing boilerplate for domain-specific constraints

Changes in this PR:

- Adds Arbitrary impl for various Holochain types
- Defines Facts for some Holochain types, which can be used for a new level of property testing when we're ready

TODO:

- [x] merge https://github.com/holochain/holochain-serialization/pull/41

SEE https://github.com/holochain/holochain/pull/884 for mock unit test

title: Various improvements, some of which actually fix a test
body:
This is kind of a big PR to fix one test, but it took a while to figure out the problem, and all of the changes I believe are improvements:

- make `AppStatusFx` (previously `AppStatusTransitionEffects`) `#[must_use]`
    - this helps ensure that any time an app state transition occurs, a followup processing of the after-effects must be done at some point to reconcile cell state with app state
- make `AppStatusFx` a monoid
    - this just means that it's easy to fold over a collection of FX to get a single FX to process, which allows us to effectively process after-effects from multiple state transitions, which is especially powerful when combined with must_use
- reorders the registration of dnas, in particular the "extra dnas" that get added by SweetConductor

title: [B-04408] New Publish Based on Neighborhood Delegate Broadcast
No concurrent init

labels.name: tiny
labels.description: This PR is really small and easy to review

body: Each Cell has a tokio Mutex guarding its init check, so init can only ever be entered once. The test I added in this PR fails with `HeadMoved` errors if the mutex is not in place, so this seems to confirm that that was the problem.

title: CellStatus connected to AppStatus
body:
This is a robust way to achieve the outcome of immediately Pausing an app whenever one of its cells fails to Join the network, whether during manual enabling or during manual or automatic restarting.

- Adds `reconcile_app_status_with_cell_status` and `reconcile_cell_status_with_app_status`, which coerces all app statuses to match the state of cells, and vice versa
- Uses cell status reconciliation to ensure that cells are properly added and removed whenever an app's status changes
    - Additionally, uses app status reconciliation when starting up an app, so that the app can be immediately paused if some cells failed to be created or fully join the network
- Uses cell status reconciliation to automatically remove "dangling" cells, i.e. cells which have no enabled app pointing to them.
    - This is used to remove cells when disabling an app, but also works in general

TODO:
- ensure kitsune can still interact with cells that are PendingJoin
- think if there are other places we need to do status reconciliation

title: 2021 05 26 must
Use no default-features for zome_types in hdk

labels.name: tiny
labels.description: This PR is really small and easy to review

body:
It seems that we haven't yet turned off the default features for holochain_zome_types in the hdk, which defeats the whole purpose of holochain_zome_types!

However, the really curious thing is, after making this change and rebuilding the test wasms, the wasm sizes *increased* by about 500 bytes! I was expecting to see a significant reduction. Perhaps rust's dead code removal is impeccable, and the 500B is just noise?

title: Add .to_hash() and .into_hashed() for any HashableContent

labels.name: tiny
labels.description: This PR is really small and easy to review

body:
Just a handy extension trait for creating HoloHash and HoloHashed from any HashableContent, and some random refactorings to use it

**TL;DR**

- `HoloHash::with_data[_sync](x)` becomes `x.to_hash()`
- `HoloHashed::from_content[_sync](x)` becomes `x.into_hashed()`

title: impl Arbitrary for DhtOp

labels.name: tiny
labels.description: This PR is really small and easy to review

body: There was no easy way that I could see to write a Fixturator for DhtOp, and I have [a new crate in the works](https://github.com/maackle/contrafact-rs) which relies on Arbitrary impls, so I added the necessary Arbitrary impls to our types.
